application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Proposal to re-roof the original house and outrigger,  repair and repaint the existing timber sash windows, a new side access door at ground floor level, new conservation rooflight on the original house with new and enlarged windows and rooflights to the outrigger including new solar panels with rear outbuilding in private garden ancillary to the main dwelling.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">All new materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7b6e6bc5-7fff-e17c-b081-05cf02669c28"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: In the interests of the visual amenities of the surrounding area. </span></p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of any development hereby approved (including demolition and all preparatory work), an Arboricultural report&nbsp;in accordance with BS 5837:2012, including a tree protection plan(s) (TPP) and an arboricultural method statement (AMS) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. </p><p>Specific issues to be dealt with in the arboricultural report: </p><p>i) Methods of demolition within the root protection area (RPA as defined in BS 5837: 2012) of the retained trees.&nbsp;</p><p>ii) Details of construction within the RPA or that may impact on the retained trees.&nbsp;</p><p>iii) A specification for protective fencing to safeguard trees during both demolition and construction phases, and a plan indicating the alignment of the protective fencing. </p><p>The London Tree Officers Association - www.ltoa.org.uk&nbsp;Tree protection during construction and construction activities clearly identified as prohibited in this area.&nbsp;</p><p>Details of site access, temporary parking, on site welfare facilities, loading, unloading and storage of equipment, materials, fuels and waste as well concrete mixing and use of fires, boundary treatments within the RPA&nbsp;Methodology and detailed assessment of root pruningThe development thereafter shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: Required prior to commencement of development to satisfy the local planning authority that the trees to be retained will not be damaged during demolition or construction and to protect and enhance the appearance and character of the site and locality.</p>
